title: American_Top_40_1971_May_22nd
description:
"Every week based on Billboard's national statistics of record sales, we count down the most popular songs in the USA."


American Top 40 with Casey Kasem aired on radio from July 4, 1970 until August 6, 1988. This recording is a rebroadcast from internet radio.

In this countdown:

Carole King sings her way into the top forty for the first time in nine years. Casey calls her the most successful singer/songwriter in the business.

There are two songs with the phrase "power to the people" in the title; one by the Plastic Ono Band (at number 31) and another by the Chi-Lites (at number 28).

The highest debuting song in the top 40 is "Rainy Days And Mondays" by The Carpenters (at number 20). This is only its second week in the hot 100.

One group in the countdown was home on break when the youngest member phoned a radio station to say thanks for playing his new solo record. When they didn't believe it was him, he got his big brother to call the station and prove it was him.
